The associated symplectic pencil (See Notes), should have       eigenvalues sufficiently away from the unit circle.
, then the generalized version of DARE
is assumed to be the identity and
is assumed to be the zero matrix.
The equation is solved by forming the extended symplectic matrix pencil, as described in ,

[  A   0   B ]             [ E   0   B ]
[ -Q  E^H -S ] - \lambda * [ 0  A^H  0 ]
[ S^H  0   R ]             [ 0 -B^H  0 ]
and using a QZ decomposition method.
In this algorithm, the fail conditions are linked to the symmetry of the product
is the 2m-by-m matrix that holds the eigenvectors spanning the stable subspace with 2-m rows and partitioned into two m-row matrices. See  and  for more details.
In order to improve the QZ decomposition accuracy, the pencil goes through a balancing step where the sum of absolute values of
rows/cols (after removing the diagonal entries) is balanced following the recipe given in . If the data has small numerical noise, balancing may amplify their effects and some clean up is required.
The boolean that indicates whether a balancing step is performed on the data. The default is set to True.
For cases where the stable subspace of the pencil could not be isolated. See Notes section and the references for details.
Solution to the discrete algebraic Riccati equation.
Solves the discrete-time algebraic Riccati equation (DARE).
Solves the continuous algebraic Riccati equation

signature.value: solve_discrete_are(a, b, q, r, e=None, s=None, balanced=True)
